settings.board.practiceAnimationSpeedDes: Control how fast moves are played when practicing repertoire positions
playerStyle.mixedStyleDescription: Versatile repertoire without a clear dominant style, adapts to different positions and opponents
playerStyle.noDataDescription: There are not enough openings in the database to analyze this player's style
playerStyle.creativeGambiteerDescription: Prefers creative gambits and offbeat lines to create early complications and surprise opponents
playerStyle.gambiteerDescription: Frequently employs gambits and sacrificial opening lines to gain dynamic compensation and initiative
playerStyle.gambiteerSimpleDescription: Often chooses gambits and speculative sacrifices in the opening phase to create tactical opportunities
playerStyle.gambiteerFallbackDescription: Frequently uses gambits or speculative sacrifices in the opening to gain dynamic play and initiative
playerStyle.systemPlayerDescription: Relies on set-up systems like London, Colle or Torre with repeatable plans and solid structures
playerStyle.classicalSolidDescription: Prefers solid defensive structures and small, long-term advantages over sharp tactical complications
playerStyle.positionalDescription: Strategic, positional player with focus on pawn structures, long-term plans and key squares
playerStyle.positionalSimpleDescription: Focuses on strategic planning, pawn structures and long-term positional advantages
playerStyle.positionalFallbackDescriptio: Strategic, positional play with focus on structures, key squares and long-term advantages
playerStyle.hypermodernDynamicDescriptio: Dynamic, hypermodern style with Indian defenses, Benoni structures, Modern Defense, or sharp Sicilian variations
playerStyle.unconventionalOpeningsDescri: Prefers rare and less theoretical openings to sidestep mainline theory and create unfamiliar positions
playerStyle.unconventionalDescription: Uses offbeat and surprise openings as a main weapon to avoid theory and create original positions
playerStyle.unconventionalFallbackDescri: Prefers unusual or rare openings to avoid theoretical preparation and create unique positions
playerStyle.dynamicTacticianDescription: Seeks complex, tactical positions with plenty of counterplay and dynamic piece activity
playerStyle.systematicDescription: Prefers structured systems and set-up based openings with consistent plans and reliable structures
playerStyle.systematicFallbackDescriptio: Relies on set-up based openings and systems with repeatable plans and solid foundations
playerStyle.tacticalDescription: Looks for combinations and concrete tactical shots, prioritizing calculation and tactical opportunities
playerStyle.tacticalFallbackDescription: Tactics and concrete calculation are a central part of the repertoire, seeking sharp positions
playerStyle.dynamicDescription: Prefers sharp, unbalanced positions with active play and dynamic piece coordination
playerStyle.dynamicFallbackDescription: Enjoys dynamic positions with active piece play and complex tactical possibilities
playerStyle.solidDescription: Values safety and sound structures over sharp play, prioritizing solidity and long-term stability
playerStyle.solidFallbackDescription: Safe and reliable repertoire with fewer risks, focusing on solid structures and defensive play
